Eggnog Bourbon Cocktail

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the festive world of cocktails where classic flavors meet holiday cheer! This Eggnog Bourbon Cocktail is the perfect blend of creamy eggnog and smooth bourbon, making it an ideal choice for your next holiday gathering or cozy night in. Rich in flavor and beautifully topped with whipped cream and spices, this cocktail not only warms you up but also adds a touch of elegance to any occasion. Whether you're celebrating Christmas, ringing in the New Year, or simply indulging in a winter treat, this delightful drink will surely impress your guests and lift your spirits. With just a few simple ingredients like eggnog, bourbon, and a sprinkle of nutmeg, you can craft a deliciously festive cocktail that encapsulates the essence of the season. Join us as we explore how to create this delightful Eggnog Bourbon Cocktail that promises to be a crowd favorite!

Ingredients

eggnog

Use homemade eggnog for fresher flavor; alternatively, store-bought eggnog is convenient. If you're looking for a lighter version, consider using eggnog made with low-fat milk or a dairy-free option like almond or coconut eggnog.

bourbon

Select a good quality bourbon to enhance the drink's flavor; sweeter bourbons complement the creaminess of eggnog. If you don’t have bourbon, try using rum or whiskey as substitutes; however, the flavor profile will change.

ground nutmeg

Use freshly grated nutmeg for a more vibrant flavor; if unavailable, ground nutmeg works well. Consider adding a pinch more to enhance the spiciness of the cocktail.

ground cinnamon

Like nutmeg, freshly ground cinnamon offers a more intense flavor; however, ground cinnamon is perfectly acceptable. You can also use a cinnamon sugar mix for an additional sweet touch if desired.

whipped cream

Homemade whipped cream is light and airy; simply whip heavy cream with a bit of sugar and vanilla extract. For a non-dairy option, use whipped coconut cream or store-bought non-dairy whipped topping.

cinnamon stick

Cinnamon sticks make a great garnish and can also infuse a subtle cinnamon flavor into the drink. You can also use star anise or a vanilla pod as a unique garnish.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Ingredients

    Gather all your ingredients: 1 cup of eggnog, 2 oz of bourbon, 1/4 tsp of ground nutmeg, 1/4 tsp of ground cinnamon, whipped cream for topping, and 1 cinnamon stick for garnish.

  • Step 2: Fill the Cocktail Shaker

    Take a cocktail shaker and fill it with ice. This will help chill your drink as you mix it. Make sure to use enough ice to fill the shaker halfway for optimal chilling.

  • Step 3: Combine the Ingredients

    Pour 1 cup of eggnog into the shaker. Then, add 2 oz of bourbon, 1/4 tsp of ground nutmeg, and 1/4 tsp of ground cinnamon to the shaker. This combination will create a rich, flavorful drink.

  • Step 4: Shake the Mixture

    Seal the shaker tightly and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds. This step is crucial as it not only mixes the ingredients but also chills them to perfection.

  • Step 5: Strain into Glass

    Using a strainer, pour the mixture into a chilled glass. You can use a festive glass for a holiday feel. Straining will ensure a smooth drink without any ice shards.

  • Step 6: Top with Whipped Cream

    Add a generous dollop of whipped cream on top of your eggnog cocktail. This adds creaminess and makes it visually appealing.

  • Step 7: Garnish and Serve

    Sprinkle a little extra ground nutmeg on top for added flavor. Finally, garnish with a cinnamon stick for a beautiful presentation and an aromatic touch.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to prepare ingredients before cooking?

Start by gathering all your ingredients and measuring them out before you begin. This is called 'mise en place' and helps you stay organized. For this eggnog bourbon cocktail, measure out the eggnog, bourbon, nutmeg, and cinnamon so you have everything ready to go.

How do I know if I’ve shaken the cocktail long enough?

Shake the cocktail for about 15-20 seconds or until the outside of the shaker feels cold. This ensures that the ingredients are well mixed and chilled.

What if I don't have a cocktail shaker?

If you don't have a cocktail shaker, you can use a jar with a tight-fitting lid. Just make sure to leave some space for the ingredients to move around.

How can I safely handle alcohol in the kitchen?

Always be mindful of your alcohol consumption, especially if you are cooking for others. Keep drinks out of reach of children and never drink while cooking if you are also handling sharp utensils or hot equipment.

Can I make this cocktail in advance?

It's best to prepare this cocktail just before serving to maintain its chill and freshness. You can measure the ingredients ahead of time, but mix it right before you want to enjoy it.

What if I want a non-alcoholic version of this cocktail?

You can replace the bourbon with additional eggnog or a non-alcoholic bourbon alternative to keep the flavor profile similar.

How do I garnish the cocktail effectively?

To garnish your cocktail, simply place a cinnamon stick in the glass and sprinkle a little extra nutmeg on top of the whipped cream. This adds a decorative touch and enhances the aroma.

What are some tips for making the whipped cream?

If you're making whipped cream from scratch, use heavy cream and beat it with a whisk or electric mixer until soft peaks form. For extra flavor, you can add a little vanilla extract or sugar.

How do I clean up efficiently after mixing cocktails?

After enjoying your cocktail, rinse out any shaker or mixing tools with warm water to prevent residue from sticking. If you used whipped cream, soak any utensils in warm soapy water to make cleaning easier.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a dairy-free version, substitute traditional eggnog with a non-dairy eggnog alternative made from almond or coconut milk. If you're looking for a lower-calorie option, consider using a light or low-sugar eggnog. For those avoiding alcohol, the cocktail can be made with a non-alcoholic bourbon substitute or simply omit the bourbon for a festive non-alcoholic eggnog drink. Always check the ingredients of store-bought eggnog for allergens if serving guests with dietary restrictions.

Pairings

This Eggnog Bourbon Cocktail pairs beautifully with rich holiday appetizers such as smoked salmon bites, cheese platters featuring creamy brie and sharp cheddar, or even spiced nuts for a crunchy contrast. For a main course, consider serving it alongside a roast turkey with cranberry sauce or glazed ham. As for beverages, it complements dessert wines like a late-harvest Riesling or even a spiced apple cider for a seasonal twist.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Eggnog Bourbon Cocktail in a chilled coupe or festive glass to enhance the holiday spirit. Consider garnishing with a sprinkle of freshly grated nutmeg or an additional pinch of cinnamon on top of the whipped cream for an aromatic finish. For a more indulgent experience, add a drizzle of caramel sauce or chocolate syrup on the inside of the glass before pouring in the cocktail. This drink is ideal for cozy gatherings, holiday parties, or as a special nightcap on cold winter evenings.

Eggnog Bourbon Cocktail

5 min
$5
350 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 1

Allergens:

Description

A creamy, spiced drink that combines the warmth of bourbon with the rich flavors of traditional eggnog, perfect for holiday cheer!

Ingredients

  • eggnog: 1 cup
  • bourbon: 2 oz
  • ground nutmeg: 1/4 tsp
  • ground cinnamon: 1/4 tsp
  • whipped cream: to top
  • cinnamon stick: 1 (for garnish)
